gists.description: Foundation related Diazo snippets

files.content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rules xmlns="http://namespaces.plone.org/diazo"
         xmlns:css="http://namespaces.plone.org/diazo/css"
         xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
         xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude">

    <rules css:if-content="#visual-portal-wrapper">
        <!-- Columns -->
        <replace css:content="#portal-column-one:not(:last-child)">
            <aside class="large-3 columns small-2">
                <xsl:apply-templates select="./*"/>
            </aside>
        </replace>
        <replace content="//*[@id='portal-column-content' and contains(@class, 'width-1:2') and contains(@class, 'position-1:4')]">
            <main class="large-6 columns">
                <xsl:apply-templates select="./*"/>
            </main >
        </replace>
        <replace css:content="#portal-column-one:last-child">
            <aside class="large-3 columns">
                <xsl:apply-templates select="./*"/>
            </aside>
        </replace>
        <replace css:content="#portal-column-two:nth-child(3)">
            <aside class="large-3 columns small-2">
                <xsl:apply-templates select="./*"/>
            </aside>
        </replace>  
    </rules>
</rules>

gists.description: transform buttons in sunburst theme to bootstrap3 buttons

files.content:
<xsl:template match="//input[@type[contains(., 'submit') or contains(., 'button')]]">
      <input>
        <xsl:copy-of select="attribute::*[not(name()='class')]" />
        <xsl:attribute name="class"><xsl:value-of select="@class" /> btn button
            <xsl:choose><xsl:when test="@class[contains(., 'destructive')]">btn-danger </xsl:when>
            <xsl:when test="@class[contains(., 'standalone')]">btn-info</xsl:when>
            <xsl:when test="@class[contains(., 'context')]">btn-primary</xsl:when>
            <xsl:otherwise>btn-default</xsl:otherwise>
            </xsl:choose>  
        </xsl:attribute>
    </input>
</xsl:template>

gists.description:
Example of using variables declared in a manifest.cfg file
From http://www.sixfeetup.com/blog/how-to-use-variables-in-diazo

Available variables that can be used within the expressions are context, request, portal, portal_state, and context_state.

files.content:
[theme:parameters]
portal_url = portal_state/portal_url
ajax_load = python: 'ajax_load' in request.form
anon_user = portal_state/anonymous

<!-- using variables defined in the manifest.cfg file -->
<drop css:content="#portal-breadcrumbs"
      if-path="$portal_url"/>

<replace css:theme="#sitesearch">
  <form action="{$portal_url}/@@search" method="post">
  ...
</replace>
Simple condition expressions can also be done in the rules using the variables:

<drop css:theme=".manageLink"
      if="$role != 'administrator'"/>

gists.description: Example of adding custom classes to all radio buttons and checkboxes in the content. (As far as I know rules like this, containing raw xsl, must be in the outer most <rules> tag, they cannot be in nested <rules> tags).

files.content:
<xsl:template match="//input[@type[contains(., 'checkbox') or contains(., 'radio')]]">
      <input>
        <xsl:copy-of select="attribute::*[not(name()='class')]" />
        <xsl:attribute name="class"><xsl:value-of select="@class" /> 
            <xsl:choose><xsl:when test="@type[contains(., 'checkbox')]"> 
             custom-checkbox-input
            </xsl:when>
            </xsl:choose>
            <xsl:choose><xsl:when test="@type[contains(., 'radio')]"> 
            custom-radio-input
            </xsl:when>
            </xsl:choose>  
        </xsl:attribute>
    </input>
</xsl:template>

gists.description:
A good demonstration of string substitution and xsl variables. The following rule takes the <title> element from the content, and replaces the last 11 characters, i.e. it substitutes "501 Commons" with "Washington Nonprofits" in the title:
see: https://solitonconsulting.com/blog/diazo-for-web-grafting

files.content:
<replace content="/html/head/title">
    <xsl:variable name="valueLength" select="string-length(//html/head/title/text())-11" />
    <title>
        <xsl:value-of select="substring(//html/head/title/text(),1,$valueLength)"/> Washington Nonprofits
    </title>
</replace>
